results.title: Murray muse
results.creator_credit: John R. Hipwell and Adis Hondo
results.brief_description:
“Murray muse” is a suite of four digital video paintings titled Earth, Fire, Air and Water. The environmental issues affecting the sustainability of one of Australia’s most precious resources, the Murray River and its surrounding ecosystems inform this Digital Video artwork.
This emergent video painting process is a vehicle whereby the consideration of other media forms (photography, painting, printmaking, cinema and television) are remediated, blended and transformed.
The four films in this Digital Video Painting DVD can be played and viewed randomly and continuously, culminating in a symbiotic relationship between sight and sound, editing and postproduction techniques, allowing the viewer to interact with the digital imagery and ambient audio either actively or passively.

results.title: The Man in the irony mask
results.creator_credit: Paul Andrew, Kath Shelper and Scarlett Pictures
results.brief_description: This documentary portrays the life and death of performance artist and AIDS activist, Brenton Heath-Kerr. Through his repertoire of performances, costumes and photographs, Heath-Kerr challenged perceptions, dominant sterotypes and myths which he thought underpinned the gay communities and notions of gay identity. An emigre of drag and a gender misfit, Heath-Kerr understood that often holding a mask up to society had more political impact than holding up a mirror. (Source: Trove)

results.title: A Park for all seasons
results.creator_credit: David Meagher and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Mossvale Park, nestled between Leongatha and Mirboo North in South Gippsland, is host to all types of community events from family barbeques to music festivals. Matt Dennis tells us why he is drawn to this “natural and beautiful place”.

results.title: Get in the picture at ACMI - Open House 25-7-04
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘In the Picture’ - a free taste of our popular Screen Adventures Program. Members of the public were invited to walk on and act up in front of ACMI’s blue screen ‘film genre’ sets.

results.title: Talks: a Natimuk Primary School animation
results.creator_credit: Dave Jones and Natimuk Primary School
results.brief_description: A collaboration between students from Natimuk Primary School and animation artists Dave Jones funded as part of the Arts Victoria Artists in Schools program. Hand drawn crayon drawings are animated and Combined with recorded soundgrabs from the kids to make an engaging sequence of simple, colourful character studies!

results.title: The Nature of paradise
results.creator_credit: Lucinda Gamble and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description:
Three women - Trish Molloy (artist), Monique La Fontaine (artist), Sharon Wiggan (law student) - tell their stories, each from a personal perspective, of their relationship and connection to the Western Australian north-west coastal town of Broome. Trish and Monique are travellers who have separately found their way to Broome and stayed and Sharon is an Aboriginal Australian who was brought up in Broome, left to study in Perth and who has now returned home to Broome. The documentary explores each woman’s emotional and spiritual attachment to the town, to their surrounding environment and their kinship with the people of Broome and with each other. Evocative and beautifully photographed by Veronica Iacono, and sensitively scripted and directed by Lucinda Gamble, “The Nature of paradise” is stunningly rich in images and colour, of reds and blues, of the earth, sky and the ocean and is accompanied by an ambient musical soundtrack, “Free diving” written and performed by Lorrei
Coffin. Interspersed throughout the documentary are images of both Trish and Monique’s paintings which reflect their transitional journey to this place called “paradise”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lucinda Gamble and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television

results.title: Cross my heart
results.creator_credit: David Swann, Andrew Wiseman, Open Channel Productions and Jocelyn Moorhouse
results.brief_description: Two women attending a friend’s funeral who died from cancer vow to quit smoking, cold turkey. There are obstacles in their way however, including a sister who has just split up with her partner, her son in tow. They instil a no smoking policy in the house with penalties for those who break the rules. Features salient points about the ill effects of smoking and the side effects you can expect when quitting. Cast includes: Marilyn O’Donnell, Parthena Amanatidis, Tamasin Ramsay, Brian Nankervis.
